This function does something on success, it returns if a packet has left the send buffer or not. Also check the comment for how this strange check works.
On success, it returns 0. On success, it *always* returns 0. There is no action this function performs, nothing to report success or failure on. Also, I checked the comment (before writing the comment), and I maintain my opinion on the sanity of this approach. So no, it does not *do* anything on success. It never does anything, it's a pure function, it computes a value, there is no failure mode. --- *[toxcore/net_crypto.c, line 3203 at r4](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/912#-LFW-5s1CcsDGor6AyL3:-LFXqQjXACs_h-2wbOG3:b-896fix) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/068d949683b90e0f40ead608d82c7bdb30d05800/toxcore/net_crypto.c#L3203)):*

Marked as WIP so it doesn't get merged.

I want to extract the other refactoring bits from this PR, so that this PR ends up only being the addition of log statements, not any of the other changes. This keeps the PR simple and small, and makes it easier for the other PRs and forks/branches to keep up with the changes.
No but this is low priority so I stopped maintaining the PR. I'm focussing on NGC now.

commit.message:
Add logging to error paths to ease debugging future changes.

E.g. if we want to add capabilities support, getting warnings logged when
the packet is rejected is very helpful. This should not add noise to the
log, because error paths are rarely taken.

author iphydf <iphydf@users.noreply.github.com> 1529242578 +0000
committer iphydf <iphydf@users.noreply.github.com> 1547228537 +0000

Add logging to error paths to ease debugging future changes.

E.g. if we want to add capabilities support, getting warnings logged when
the packet is rejected is very helpful. This should not add noise to the
log, because error paths are rarely taken.

title: WIP: Add logging to error paths to ease debugging future changes.
